faq.title: Sıkça Sorulan Sorular
faq.subtitle: Viyana'da işletme tesisi izni, ticaret kaydı ve şirket kuruluşu hakkında bilmeniz gerekenler

q1.question: İşletme tesisi nedir ve izin almam gerekir mi?
q1.answer: Bir işletme tesisi (Betriebsanlage), bir ticari faaliyeti yürütmek için kullanılan her türlü kurulumdur. Buna iş yerleri, atölyeler, depolar, restoranlar ve çok daha fazlası dahildir. İzin gerekip gerekmediği; işletmenin türüne, büyüklüğüne, konumuna, çalışma saatlerine ve olası rahatsızlıklara (gürültü, koku) bağlıdır. İzin muafiyeti yönetmeliği (Genehmigungsfreistellungsverordnung), hangi işletmelerin izin almadan faaliyet gösterebileceğini belirler. İşletmenizin izne tabi olup olmadığını öğrenmek için ücretsiz kontrolümüzü kullanın.

q2.question: Viyana'da işletme tesisi iznini almak ne kadar sürer?
q2.answer: Süre, işletmenizin karmaşıklığına göre değişir. Komşu katılımı olmayan basit durumlar: 4-8 hafta. Komşuların bilgilendirildiği karmaşık tesisler: 3-6 ay. Yetkili kurum Viyana Ticaret Dairesi MA 36'dır. İpucu: Tüm belgelerle birlikte eksiksiz bir başvuru süreci önemli ölçüde hızlandırır.

q3.question: İşletme tesisi izni ne kadar tutar?
q3.answer: Ücretler idari iş yüküne bağlıdır. Basitleştirilmiş prosedür: yaklaşık 100-300 avro. Uzman raporlu normal prosedür: 500-2000 avro. Büyük veya karmaşık tesisler: 2000-5000 avro ve üzeri. Uzmanlar, planlar ve teknik kanıtlar için ek maliyetler doğabilir. Kesin tarifeler wien.gv.at adresinde yer alır.

q4.question: İzni almadan önce işletmemi açabilir miyim?
q4.answer: Hayır, işletmeniz izne tabi ise onay almadan başlamamalısınız. Bu durum 50.000 avroya kadar para cezası içeren bir idari suçtur. Muaf işletmeler (muafiyet yönetmeliğine göre) ticaret kaydından hemen sonra başlayabilir. İzne ihtiyacınız olup olmadığını belirlemek için kontrolümüzden yararlanın.

q5.question: İşletme tesisi izni için hangi belgelere ihtiyacım var?
q5.answer: Standart belgeler: Ticaret ruhsatı veya imtiyaz, kat planı ve vaziyet planı, tesis açıklaması, kullanım hakkı kanıtı (kira sözleşmesi/mülkiyet belgesi), teknik açıklamalar (ör. havalandırma, gürültü). İşletmeye bağlı olarak ayrıca: gürültü raporu, yangın koruma planı, statik raporu, çevresel etki değerlendirmesi. MA 36 hangi belgelerin gerekli olduğunu önceden danışmanlıkla açıklar.

q6.question: Ticaret kaydı ile işletme tesisi izni arasındaki fark nedir?
q6.answer: Ticaret kaydı: Bir ticari faaliyeti yürütmenize izin verir (ticaret idaresinde). İşletme tesisi izni: Belirli bir lokasyonda faaliyete olanak tanır (gürültü, güvenlik, komşular dikkate alınır). İKİSİNE de ihtiyacınız var: önce ticaret ruhsatı, ardından lokasyon için işletme tesisi izni. Bazı işletmeler izin yükümlülüğünden muaftır (muafiyet yönetmeliğine bakın).

q7.question: Muafiyet yönetmeliği benim için geçerli mi?
q7.answer: Viyana muafiyet yönetmeliği, belirli kriterleri karşılayan bazı işletmeleri izin yükümlülüğünden muaf tutar. Örnekler: 600 m²'ye kadar perakende, ofisler (neredeyse her zaman), küçük atölyeler, güzellik salonları, havuzsuz 30 yatağa kadar konaklama. ANCAK: Gürültü, müzik, tehlikeli maddeler veya bina kabuğu dışına çıkan mekanik havalandırma durumlarında istisnalar vardır. Hızlı bir değerlendirme için kontrolümüzü kullanın.

q8.question: Viyana'da bir restoran işletmecisi olarak işletme tesisi iznine ihtiyacım var mı?
q8.answer: Evet, çoğu durumda. Gastronomi işletmeleri (restoranlar, kafeler, barlar) genellikle şu nedenlerle izne tabidir: koku emisyonları (mutfak), gürültü (misafirler, müzik), yağ tutucular, havalandırma sistemleri. İstisnalar: Oturma alanı olmayan küçük dondurmacılar muaf olabilir. Süreç 3-6 ay sürebilir – açılış planlamanıza bunu dahil edin!

q9.question: Almanca konuşmuyorum – yine de iş kurabilir miyim?
q9.answer: Evet! Web sitemiz 8 dili destekliyor: Almanca, İngilizce, Sırpça, Hırvatça, Türkçe, İtalyanca, İspanyolca ve Ukraynaca. Resmî işlemler için: MA 36 ve Ticaret Odası çok dilli danışmanlık sunar. Ticaret kaydı için gerekli belgeler: pasaport/kimlik, sosyal güvenlik numarası ve gerekirse belgeler için tercüman. Viyana'daki birçok girişim hizmeti çok dillidir.

q10.question: Komşularım işletme tesisime itiraz ederse ne olur?
q10.answer: İzne tabi tesislerde komşular süreç boyunca bilgilendirilir (komşu katılımı). Şu konularda itirazda bulunabilirler: aşırı gürültü, koku rahatsızlığı, güvenlik endişeleri, trafik sorunları. Yetkili makam itirazları inceler ve koşullar getirebilir (ör. gürültü koruması, çalışma saatleri kısıtlamaları). İyi planlama ve komşularla erken iletişim pek çok çatışmayı önler.

gfvoChecker.title: Assess permit exemption under the 2nd GFVO
gfvoChecker.intro: Answer three questions to receive a legally grounded assessment of whether your facility is permit-free.
gfvoChecker.disclaimer:
Note: This tool provides orientation.
It checks whether your business generally falls under an exemption of Vienna’s 2nd Permit Exemption Ordinance.
The result is not an administrative decision or legal advice under the Legal Services Act.
The binding decision is made by MA 36 (Vienna business facilities authority).

category.title: Which category applies to the facility?
category.description: Select the category from § 1 (1) nos. 1–13 of the 2nd GFVO that best matches your planned operation.
category.hint: Tip: If none apply, choose “None of the categories” to receive an immediate permit-required result.

operatingTimes.title: Do you comply with the operating time limits?
operatingTimes.description: Permit-free facilities must run Monday–Friday 06:00–22:00 and Saturday 06:00–19:00 (deliveries until 19:00/18:00).

compliant.title: Yes, we stay within these windows
compliant.description: Operation is limited to the hours specified in § 1 (2) of the 2nd GFVO.

notCompliant.title: No, longer opening/delivery times planned
notCompliant.description: Night-time, Sunday business or deliveries outside the permitted windows are foreseen.

operatingTimes.reminder: Exceptions apply only to accommodation, ice-cream parlours, textile pick-up stations, data centres as well as facilities in stations, airports, ports or approved complexes (§ 1 (2) 2nd GFVO).

exclusions.title: Do any § 2 2nd GFVO exclusions apply?
exclusions.description: Check every statement that fits. A single exclusion triggers the permit requirement.
exclusions.reminder: Only if none of the § 2 2nd GFVO exclusions are triggered will the facility remain permit-free.

retail.title: Retail up to 600 m²
retail.description: e.g. shop, boutique or store with max. 600 m² sales area.

office.title: Office operation
office.description: Pure office/service rooms without noise-intensive machinery.

warehouse.title: Indoor warehouse up to 600 m²
warehouse.description: Closed storage for goods or supplies up to 600 m².

beauty.title: Cosmetics & personal care
beauty.description: Cosmetic, foot care, hairdresser, massage and bandagist businesses.

tailor.title: Tailoring & shoe service
tailor.description: Alteration tailors, household-type sewing shops or cobblers.

dental.title: Dental studio/lab
dental.description: Without smelting furnace or only with a furnace connected to a chimney.

accommodation.title: Accommodation (max. 30 beds)
accommodation.description: Hotels/guesthouses without wellness area, offering at most breakfast or light snacks.

iceCreamParlor.title: Ice-cream parlour
iceCreamParlor.description: Catering business operated purely as an ice-cream parlour.

textilePickup.title: Textile pick-up station
textilePickup.description: Drop-off points for dry-cleaning/ironing without on-site processing.

dataCenter.title: Data centre
dataCenter.description: Electronic data processing without own firing systems (emergency power allowed).

insideInfrastructure.title: Facility inside station, airport, port or hospital
insideInfrastructure.description: Facility located within an already approved transport hub or hospital.

withinComplex.title: Small facility up to 400 m² in an approved complex
withinComplex.description: e.g. shop inside a shopping mall with an existing overall permit.

none.title: None of the categories apply
none.description: The planned facility cannot be assigned to the types listed in § 1 (1) of the 2nd GFVO.

externalVentilation.question: Are there outdoor ventilation or AC units?
externalVentilation.description: External fans, AC units or exhaust/waste-heat devices fall under § 2 (1) of the 2nd GFVO.

regulatedStorage.question: Do you store hazardous substances with special legal storage rules?
regulatedStorage.description: E.g. larger amounts of flammable liquids, gas cylinders or LPG requiring specific storage (§ 2 (2) 2nd GFVO).

unregulatedHazards.question: Do you store labelled hazardous substances without special rules?
unregulatedHazards.description: Even without specific regulations, storing labelled hazardous chemicals triggers § 2 (3) 2nd GFVO.

loudMusic.question: Is loud music or live performance planned?
loudMusic.description: Anything beyond low-level background music (≈ 58 dB(A)) counts as music activity under § 2 (4) 2nd GFVO.

ippcSeveso.question: Does the project fall under IPPC or Seveso?
ippcSeveso.description: Large-scale plants subject to EIA/major-accident rules (§ 2 (5) 2nd GFVO) remain permit-bound.

permitFree.title: Permit-free under the 2nd GFVO
permitFree.subtitle: All requirements of the 2nd GFVO are met – no facility permit is currently required.
permitFree.note: Continue to comply with the stated assumptions (category, operating times, no exclusions). Any change requires a new assessment or the exemption no longer applies.

permitRequired.title: Permit requirement applies
permitRequired.subtitle: At least one condition of the 2nd GFVO is not fulfilled. A facility permit under § 74 GewO is therefore required.
permitRequired.nextStepsIntro: Submit an application to MA 36 – Betriebsanlagen (responsible regional centre) before construction or start-up.
permitRequired.documentsTitle: Typical documents requested by the City of Vienna
documents: List of machines and equipment with performance/emission data
Site plan, floor plans and sections of the premises (multiple copies)
Technical descriptions of special installations (e.g. ventilation, heating, cooling)
Evidence for related legal areas (e.g. building, water, labour or fire safety law)
permitRequired.contactHint: Recommendation: Contact the responsible centre in advance (project consultation day) or file a declaratory application if unclear.

reasons.categoryMet: The facility belongs to {category} and is covered by the permit-free categories in § 1 (1) of the 2nd GFVO.
reasons.operatingTimesMet: Planned operating and delivery times follow the limits of § 1 (2) 2nd GFVO.
reasons.operatingTimesExempt: {category} is exempt from the operating time limits according to § 1 (2) 2nd GFVO.
reasons.noExclusions: None of the exclusion criteria in § 2 2nd GFVO are triggered.
reasons.categoryMissing: The facility cannot be assigned to any category in § 1 (1) 2nd GFVO – a permit is required.
reasons.operatingTimesMissing: Planned operating or delivery hours exceed the permitted windows (§ 1 (2) 2nd GFVO) – exemption no longer applies.
reasons.externalVentilation: Outdoor ventilation or AC units trigger § 2 (1) 2nd GFVO, making the facility permit-bound.
reasons.regulatedStorage: Hazardous materials subject to special storage rules (§ 2 (2) 2nd GFVO) prevent exemption.
reasons.unregulatedHazards: Storing labelled hazardous substances without special rules falls under § 2 (3) 2nd GFVO, requiring a permit.
reasons.loudMusic: Planned loud music or performances exceed the background music allowance (§ 2 (4) 2nd GFVO).
reasons.ippcSeveso: The project is within the IPPC/Seveso scope (§ 2 (5) 2nd GFVO) and remains permit-bound.

complianceChecker.title: Betriebsanlagen codex (Austrian Trade Act)
complianceChecker.subtitle: Work through the structured review covering facility status, permit duty, submission documents, worker protection metrics, and operational duties.

sector.question: Which business type are you planning?
sector.helper: The codex covers retail, services, hospitality/accommodation, workshops, logistics, cosmetics, data centres, and self-service concepts.

descriptions.beherbergung: Max. 30 beds, building used only for living/accommodation, no wellness facilities, breakfast or small snacks only.
descriptions.iceSalon: Pure ice-cream parlour without a full kitchen.
descriptions.otherGastro: Gastronomy concepts outside the GFVO ice-cream exemption.

isStationary.question: Is the activity tied to a fixed location?

isOnlyTemporary.question: Is it only a temporary or short-term use?

buildingUseExclusive.question: Is the building used exclusively for living/accommodation purposes?

hasWellnessFacilities.question: Are wellness or bathing facilities (pool, sauna, spa) planned?

servesFullMeals.question: Will meals beyond breakfast/snacks be served?

location.heading: Location & building compliance
location.helper: Confirm zoning, land-use designation, and existing building approvals.

zoningClarified.question: Is the zoning / land-use plan suitable for the intended use?

buildingConsentPresent.question: Is there a valid building and usage permit for the premises?

operations.heading: Operations & emissions
operations.helper: Review opening hours, emissions, hazardous materials, and technical plant.

operatingPattern.question: Which operating hours do you require?

descriptions.gfvoWindow: Standard daytime hours including the GFVO delivery window.
descriptions.extendedHours: Hours outside the exemption but not permanently round-the-clock.

hasExternalVentilation.question: Do you install outdoor ventilation, condenser, or exhaust units?

storesRegulatedHazardous.question: Do you store hazardous materials subject to special regulations (flammable liquids, gas, etc.)?

storesLabelledHazardous.question: Do you store other label-required hazardous substances in relevant quantities?

usesLoudMusic.question: Will music performances or amplified sound above background level take place?

ippcOrSevesoRelevant.question: Do IPPC/Seveso thresholds (Trade Act Annex 3, major accident rules) apply?

context.heading: Impacts & special cases
context.helper: Assess environmental impacts, infrastructure locations, and existing permits.

expectedImpairments.question: Are adverse effects under § 74 (2) Trade Act expected?

locatedInInfrastructureSite.question: Is the business located within a railway, airport, port, or hospital site?

locatedInApprovedComplex.question: Is the business inside an already approved overall complex (e.g. shopping centre)?

existingPermitHistory.question: Do existing permits or suitability rulings for the site exist?

reasons.externalVentilation: Outdoor ventilation or cooling units trigger permit duty under Sec. 2 item 2 2nd GFVO.
reasons.regulatedHazardousStorage: Hazardous materials governed by special regulations exclude the exemption (Sec. 2 item 3).
reasons.labelledHazardousStorage: Label-required hazardous substances without specific storage rules remain permit-required (Sec. 2 item 4).
reasons.musicExclusion: Music performances or loud sound exclude the exemption (Sec. 2 item 5).
reasons.ippcSeveso: IPPC / Seveso relevant plants are always permit cases (Sec. 2 item 6).
reasons.noFacilityDefinition: No stationary, non-temporary facility – therefore the codex stops here.
reasons.operatingHours: Planned hours exceed the 2nd GFVO window (Sec. 1 (2)).
reasons.areaExceeded: The given area exceeds the threshold of the selected exemption category.
reasons.accommodationBeds: More than 30 beds require a permit (Sec. 1 (1) item 8).
reasons.accommodationBuildingUse: The building is not used exclusively for living/accommodation – exemption condition missing.
reasons.accommodationWellness: Wellness or bathing facilities are not covered by the exemption.
reasons.accommodationMeals: Serving full meals exceeds the breakfast/snack limitation of the exemption.
reasons.expectedImpairments: § 74 (2) Trade Act impacts (emissions, hazards, disturbances) are expected.
reasons.individualAssessment: No clear exemption – request a declaratory ruling for certainty.
reasons.freistellungSummary: All requirements of the 2nd exemption ordinance are met – the facility remains permit-free as long as the conditions are respected.

noFacility.title: No business facility under the Trade Act
noFacility.summary: The activity is mobile or only temporary and therefore outside the facility definition (§ 74 Trade Act).

freistellungGFVO.title: Permit-free under the 2nd GFVO
freistellungGFVO.summary: All category, time, and exclusion requirements of the 2nd exemption ordinance are fulfilled.

needsPermit.title: Permit-required facility
needsPermit.summary: Exclusion grounds or expected impacts apply – a § 74 Trade Act procedure is necessary.

individualAssessment.title: Individual assessment recommended
individualAssessment.summary: No clear exemption applies; the authority can issue a declaratory ruling on permit exemption.

gfvoCategories.retail: Retail up to 600 m² (Sec. 1 (1) item 1 2nd GFVO)
gfvoCategories.office: Office operations without noisy machinery (Sec. 1 (1) item 2)
gfvoCategories.warehouse: Indoor warehouses up to 600 m² (Sec. 1 (1) item 3)
gfvoCategories.cosmetics: Cosmetics, foot care, massage businesses (Sec. 1 (1) item 4)
gfvoCategories.tailor: Alteration tailoring / household sewing or shoe service (Sec. 1 (1) item 5)
gfvoCategories.accommodation: Accommodation ≤ 30 beds, no wellness, breakfast/snacks only (Sec. 1 (1) item 8)
gfvoCategories.dataCenter: Data centre without own firing plant (only emergency power engines) (Sec. 1 (1) item 11)
gfvoCategories.infrastructureSite: Facility inside approved railway, airport, port, or hospital sites (Sec. 1 (1) item 12)
gfvoCategories.embeddedFacility: Facility up to 400 m² inside an already approved complex (Sec. 1 (1) item 13)

procedural.authority: The competent authority is the district authority (Vienna: MA 36 – Betriebsanlagen).
procedural.projectProcedure: Permit cases require a full project submission with complete documentation.
procedural.permitEffect: Construction and operation may start only after the permit becomes legally effective.
procedural.eignungsfeststellung: Existing suitability rulings continue to act as facility-specific permits.
procedural.projectSprech: Authority project consultation days speed up expert coordination.
procedural.feeHint: Federal fees were abolished in 2017; start-ups may claim NeuföG fee relief.

general.application: Application form for establishing/modifying the facility (signed).
general.description: Operational description covering activity, hours, staffing, traffic, storage, ventilation, etc.
general.sitePlans: Site plan plus floor plans/sections (typically scale 1:100).
general.ventilationPlan: Plan or description of the ventilation/exhaust system including discharge path.
general.machineList: Machine and equipment list with ratings, media, and layout plan.
general.emissionStatement: Statement on noise, air, traffic emissions including planned mitigation.
general.wasteConcept: Waste management concept in line with Trade Act / City of Vienna guidance.
general.wasteWater: Evidence of wastewater discharge notification or permit where required.

sector.gastroExhaust: Hospitality/accommodation: kitchen exhaust proof according to state of the art (e.g. EN 16282-1).
sector.guestSanitary: Guest sanitary rooms per building code (OIB guideline 3, Austrian 'Kellner' rule).
sector.hygiene: Sector-specific hygiene documentation (food hygiene, grease separators, etc.).

labour.roomHeight: Work rooms generally require 3.0 m room height (deviations to be agreed with labour inspectorate).
labour.daylight: Natural daylight openings ≥ 10% of floor area; justify exceptions for basements, etc.
labour.ventilation: Natural ventilation ≥ 2% of floor area or mechanical systems providing 35/50/70 m³/h fresh air per person (load dependent).
labour.exhaustDischarge: Discharge exhaust over the roof or sufficiently high with filtration (30–40 dB(A) at outlet).
labour.escapeRoutes: Escape routes: maximum 10 m to reach a route; ensure cross ventilation if depth > 10 m.
labour.escapeWidths: Escape widths by occupancy: 1–20 people 1.0 m | 21–120 people 1.2 m | add 0.1 m per extra 10 people.
labour.emergencyDoors: Emergency exit widths: up to 40 people 0.8 m, up to 80 people 0.9 m, up to 120 people 1.0 m; doors >15 people must open in escape direction.
labour.safetyLighting: Provide emergency lighting where no natural light or evening/night operation exists.
labour.staffSanitary: Staff sanitary rooms: at least one lockable cubicle per 15 persons, separate units from 5 female/male upwards, include lobby/ventilation.

operationalDuties.startAfterPermit: Operation may only begin after the permit has become final (§ 74 Trade Act).
operationalDuties.periodicInspection: § 82b Trade Act: periodic inspection every 5 years (6 years for simplified procedure), except UMG register facilities.
operationalDuties.inspectionScope: Inspection covers compliance with permit, plans, and co-applicable regulations (§ 356b).
operationalDuties.inspectionCertificate: Inspection report must list facility, site, inspector competence, permits, checked regulations, and findings.
operationalDuties.deficiencyDuties: Remedy deficiencies promptly; non-compliance can trigger administrative fines (§ 366).

changeDuties.notifyChanges: Significant changes must be reported before implementation (§ 81 (3) Trade Act).
changeDuties.operationAfterNotice: Operate modified installations only after the authority's acknowledgement (within 2 months).

preCheck.contactChamber: Contact the chamber / business support service early.
preCheck.clarifyBuildingLaw: Clarify zoning, land-use and building permits before starting the project.
preCheck.engageNeighbours: Inform neighbours early to avoid conflicts.
preCheck.reviewOSH: Incorporate occupational safety requirements (AStV, OSH) in the design.
preCheck.clarifyPermitNeed: Clarify permit duty with the authority or request a declaratory ruling.
preCheck.prepareCompleteSet: Prepare a complete documentation set – full submissions speed up processing.

specialNotes.selfService: Container shops/self-service outlets: check zoning and building compliance; permits may be needed depending on emissions.
specialNotes.buildingProcedure: Building and trade procedures run separately – changes of use require separate building approval.
specialNotes.existingPermits: Document existing permits or suitability rulings and include them in the submission.

quickReferences.definition: Definition & five steps: WKO guide 'Weg zum genehmigten Betrieb'.
quickReferences.section82b: Regular inspection under § 82b Trade Act – authorised inspectors, intervals, report content.
